programme.title: Broadway to Cheyenne
programme.desc: A New York police officer, shot and wounded by a gangster, travels to Cheyenne, Wyo., to recuperate at his family's ranch, and is surprised to find a bootlegger from New York running a speakeasy there.

programme.title: Born to Battle
programme.desc: Cattlemen offer a jailed cowboy his freedom if he will agree to help locate a gang of notorious rustlers.

programme.title: Abilene Town
programme.desc: A saloon singer (Ann Dvorak) and her rival like a marshal (Randolph Scott) who cleans up a drunken sheriff's (Edgar Buchanan) cow town.

programme.title: Brand of the Devil
programme.desc: Tex Wyatt (Dave "Tex" O'Brien), Jim Steel (Jim Newill) and Panhandle Perkins (Guy Wilkerson) are Texas Rangers working undercover to bust up a cattle rustling ring that leaves cards bearing a devilish pitchfork to announce its presence.

programme.title: Cowboy G-Men
programme.desc: Pat and Stoney investigate how U.S. currency in a bank vault was replaced by counterfeit money.

programme.title: Cowboy G-Men
programme.desc: Pat and Stoney get reports that a man is selling mines to investors that have been salted; the two g-men are determined to discover the truth.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.sub-title: Is There a Doctor in the Roundhouse?
programme.desc: Curtis breaks the throttle of the Cannonball and blocks the way to Kate's jamboree.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: Kate tries to restore the self confidence of Floyd Smoot after he is jilted by his mail-order sweetheart, by pretending to be in love with him.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: A clever criminal hopes to rob a wealthy rancher, but Cisco and Pancho bring the man to justice.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: An escaped convict is nearly murdered while trying to prove that he did not commit a crime.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: The 1850s California gold fields is home to notorious bandit Joaquin Murietta; Matt and Frankie arrive to track him down but he kidnaps Frankie; Matt and Captain Love trail Murietta to the bitter end.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Tiburcio Vasquez vows vengeance against Anglos after his sister Dolores is killed; Matt and Frankie try to stop his years of terror in Southern California after a railroad agent is killed with the help of local priest.

programme.title: Judge Roy Bean
programme.desc: The judge meets up with a con man who comes to towns and arranges horse races; he then skips town with the receipts and all the money that was bet.

programme.title: Judge Roy Bean
programme.desc: A gang plans to take over the town by getting Judge Bean to resign over false misconduct charges.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: Annie, Lofty and Tagg (Gail Davis, Brad Johnson, Jimmy Hawkins) step in when a store owner is killed and his young daughter is left blind. With Judy Nugent.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: Annie becomes suspicious of Elaine Forbes, the seemingly innocent niece of a recently deceased rancher.

programme.title: Hawkeye and the Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: After a long winter, the Tuscarora tribe struggles for survival; Hawkeye and Chingachcook set out to help.Starring John Hart as Hawkeye, and Lon Chaney Jr as Chingachcook.

programme.title: Hawkeye and the Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: The daughter of Mingo Chief Nocona is desired by two warring tribesmen.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: A wanderer seeking his parents' lynchers, arrives in Virginia City as Ben and Adam are convicted of murder.

programme.title: Down Texas Way
programme.desc: Three U.S. Marshals (Buck Jones, Tim McCoy, Raymond Hatton) work under cover to foil a gang of racketeers.

programme.title: Robin Hood of the Pecos
programme.desc: A night rider (George "Gabby" Hayes) and his singing partner (Roy Rogers) send Texas carpetbaggers packing.

programme.title: Song of Arizona
programme.desc: A youth from Gabby Whittaker's (George "Gabby" Hayes) Half-a-Chance Ranch for boys from troubled homes becomes a pawn in the fight between his late father's gang and Roy Rogers.

programme.title: Custer's Last Stand
programme.desc: The search for a missing medicine arrow sparks a series of Indian attacks. Feature version of the serial.

programme.title: Six-Gun Trail
programme.desc: Posing as an Asian, a Washington agent goes after a gem-smuggling outlaw gang.

programme.title: Blue Steel
programme.desc: Marshal John Carruthers helps a sheriff find out who stole the town's payroll, and together they discover the town's leader stole the money to buy up all the land.

programme.title: Outpost in Morocco
programme.desc: A French Foreign Legion captain (George Raft) loves an enemy Arab chieftain's daughter (Marie Windsor).

programme.title: Lost Canyon
programme.desc: After Johnny (Jay Kirby) is accused of robbing a bank, he runs into the hills. When his friend Hopalong Cassidy (William Boyd) hears what happened, Hopalong sets out to find the real bad guys.

programme.title: Wagon Trail
programme.desc: Townsfolk turn against their sheriff (Harry Carey) because of his outlaw son (Edward Norris).

programme.title: Brothers of the West
programme.desc: Detective Tom Wade (Tom Tyler) has to investigate the truth behind a robbery and murder of a bank president that's being blamed on Tom's brother, Ed (Bob Terry), who is nowhere to be found.
